tips.li: Granite is the hardest common stone and has moderate beauty, but is also the hardest to mine.
Slate sometimes yields natraully rectangular blocks that can be used for building without stonecutting.
Marble is a beautiful and relatively hard stone, but does not yield many chunks.
Sandstone is a beautiful and somewhat soft stone that yields lots of chunks.
Limestone is a somewhat hard stone that yields lots of stone chunks.
Basalt is a hard stone, but is not very attrative. Basalt terrain is rocky and difficult to traverse and build on.
Stone types influence landscape attributes, such as easy of building and travesal and amount of cover in a gunfight.
